title: Max Absolute Sum Subarray

videos.title: Maximum Absolute Sum of Any Subarray - Leetcode 1749

articles.title: Maximum Absolute Sum of Any Subarray

patternTriggers: Use Double Kadane's (Max and Min) when finding maximum absolute value of subarray sum. Key indicators: absolute value, contiguous subarray, need both maximum and minimum sums, take max of |maxSum| and |minSum|.

approaches.name: Run Both Max and Min Kadane's
approaches.intuition: Maximum absolute sum is either the maximum subarray sum or absolute value of minimum subarray sum. Run Kadane's algorithm twice: once for maximum sum, once for minimum sum. Return the maximum of their absolute values.
approaches.approach: Apply standard Kadane's to find maximum subarray sum. Apply modified Kadane's to find minimum subarray sum. Return max(maxSum, |minSum|).
steps: Find maximum subarray sum using Kadane's:
Find minimum subarray sum using modified Kadane's:

complexity.timeExplanation: Two passes through array: O(n) for max Kadane's + O(n) for min Kadane's = O(n) total.
complexity.spaceExplanation: Only constant extra variables. O(1) space.

code.python:
def maxAbsoluteSum(nums):
    # Find maximum subarray sum
    max_sum = nums[0]
    current_max = nums[0]
    
    for i in range(1, len(nums)):
        current_max = max(nums[i], current_max + nums[i])
        max_sum = max(max_sum, current_max)
    
    # Find minimum subarray sum
    min_sum = nums[0]
    current_min = nums[0]
    
    for i in range(1, len(nums)):
        current_min = min(nums[i], current_min + nums[i])
        min_sum = min(min_sum, current_min)
    
    # Return maximum absolute value
    return max(max_sum, abs(min_sum))

approaches.name: Single Pass - Track Both Max and Min
approaches.intuition: Instead of two separate passes, track both maximum and minimum subarray sums in single pass. At each position, update both currentMax and currentMin, then update result with maximum absolute value.
approaches.approach: Maintain currentMax and currentMin simultaneously. Update both at each step using Kadane's logic. Track the maximum absolute value throughout.

complexity.timeExplanation: Single pass through array. O(n) time.

code.python:
def maxAbsoluteSum(nums):
    current_max = nums[0]
    current_min = nums[0]
    result = abs(nums[0])
    
    for i in range(1, len(nums)):
        current_max = max(nums[i], current_max + nums[i])
        current_min = min(nums[i], current_min + nums[i])
        
        result = max(result, current_max, abs(current_min))
    
    return result

commonMistakes: Only finding maximum sum and forgetting minimum sum can have larger absolute value
Not taking absolute value of minimum sum before comparing
Initializing result to 0 instead of first element's absolute value
Confusing absolute value of sum with sum of absolute values
Not handling all negative arrays correctly
Forgetting that minimum sum is negative, so |minSum| is positive
Comparing maxSum with minSum directly instead of |minSum|
hints: Maximum absolute sum is either a very positive sum or a very negative sum
Run Kadane's algorithm to find maximum subarray sum
Run modified Kadane's to find minimum subarray sum
Take the maximum of maxSum and |minSum|
You can do both in a single pass if you track both simultaneously
Remember: absolute value makes negative sums positive
